Package algorithms.compGeometry

Class HoughTransform

java.lang.Object
algorithms.compGeometry.HoughTransform
public class HoughTransform extends Object
a class for Hough transforms of simple geometric shapes. currently a line is implemented. Helpful in starting this was a look at the code available from http://vase.essex.ac.uk/software/HoughTransform/ and http://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/HIPR2/flatjavasrc/Hough.java though this implementation is different.
Author:
nichole

  • Method Details

    • calculateLineGivenEdge

      public Map<algorithms.util.PairInt,Set<algorithms.util.PairInt>> calculateLineGivenEdge(algorithms.util.PairIntArray edge, int imageWidth, int imageHeight)
      given an edge of points, computes the Hough transform of lines and returns results as an associate array with key = pair with x = polar theta in degrees and y = distance from the origin in pixels; value = number of transformation points having the key. Note that the angle is calculated for expectations of a counter clockwise ordered curve and the vector of the angle is perpendicular to p1 (direction given by right hand rule). The angles are 0 to 360. Note that if the edge has less than 3 points, an empty map is returned. runtime complexity is O(N_edge_pts), but includes transcendental operations.
      Parameters:
      edge - a curve defined by the points within
      imageWidth -
      imageHeight -
      Returns:
      thetaRadiusPixCoords mappings
